lenders.name: KCS
lenders.loan_because: We  like to help people out of poverty by giving them more control over their futures.
lenders.occupational_info:
We started in Autumn 2009 by wanting to create our own microfinance bank after researching microfinance as part of the IB Geography course. Once we found Kiva, we decided it would be more efficient to use Kiva and concentrate our energy on raising money to lend. At first we decided to raise money by recycling mobile 'phones. This raised our first £1304 in April 2010 as part of the biennial Make A Difference Day. In Spring 2011, we entered a second round of mobile 'phone recycling which raised £1212.50. So far we had raised the money without directly asking people for financial donations, which we liked.

In Spring 2011 a group of 3 students entered the school's Chiara charity competition and won 80% of the prize fund for Kiva (£8000!). This significantly increased our seed fund and we hope that all members of the school will be able to be involved in choosing entrepreneurs to lend to and track their progress.

Our next core funding boost came in December 2011, from a group of pupils who formed their own business, called Icon, as part of the King's Enterprise Challenge. They sourced and sold bespoke clothing such as hooded tops, which they sold to other pupils. They contributed their profit of £240 to our Kiva fund, an especially generous gesture, given how hard they had worked to earn the money.

We were thrilled to pass through the 1000 loan mark around Christmas 2011.

In February 2012, we undertook our next episode of recycling, which involved collecting unwanted CDs, DVDs and computer games. This yielded over £1400 for our overall fund.

We were very pleased to break the $50,000 mark in terms of loans made in August 2012!

We hit the 2000 loan mark on September 25th 2012!

We took part in Make A Difference Day 2012 on October 5th at KCS. We were collecting unwanted phones, CDs, DVDs, computer games and MP3 players, raising a total of £1162.67!

We hit the 2500 loan mark on 26th February 2013!
